## Supervised Learning: Data

-  $\D = \Dset$ data set with $n$ observations
-  $\xyi$ $i$-th observation

```{r,echo=FALSE, fig.height=4, warning=FALSE}
library(ggplot2)

df4 = iris
df4 = df4[c(1, 80, 90, 110, 130), ]

ggplot(data = df4, aes(x = Petal.Length, y = Petal.Width)) +
  geom_point(size = 4) +
  annotate("text", x = df4$Petal.Length-0.17, y = df4$Petal.Width - 0.2,
    label = "(") +
  annotate("text", x = df4$Petal.Length-0.06, y = df4$Petal.Width - 0.2,
    label = paste("x^{(", 1:nrow(df4), ")}"), parse = TRUE) +
  annotate("text", x = df4$Petal.Length, y = df4$Petal.Width - 0.2,
    label = ", ") +
  annotate("text", x = df4$Petal.Length + 0.12, y = df4$Petal.Width - 0.22,
    label = paste("y^{(", 1:nrow(df4), ")}"), parse = TRUE) +
  annotate("text", x = df4$Petal.Length + 0.23, y = df4$Petal.Width - 0.2,
    label = ")") +
  xlab("x") +
  ylab("y")
```

<!--
-  $\Dtrain$, $\Dtest$ data for training and testing, often $\D = \Dtrain \dot{\cup} ~ \Dtest$
-  $\fx$ or $\fxt \in \R$ prediction function learnt on data, we might suppress $\theta$ in notation
-  $\hx$ or $\hxt \in \Yspace$ discrete prediction for classification
-  $\theta \in \Theta$ model parameters
-->
